item.title: Cleveland Woman Dies by Physical Restraint in Custody of Sheriff’s Deputy at MetroHealth
item.description: A special prosecutor is reviewing the actions of hospital workers and a sheriff’s deputy after the medical examiner ruled Tasha Grant’s death a homici...

item.title: These States Want People to Pay in Cash to Get Out of Jail
item.description: Encouraged by Trump, some lawmakers are championing cash bail, undercutting reforms that advocates say made the system fairer for poor people.

item.title: The Marshall Project Honored With Multiple Journalism Awards
item.description: Honors hail from the Institute for Nonprofit News, the Online News Association, and NLGJA: The Association of LGBTQ+ Journalists.

item.title: How Missouri Has Let Police Officers Stay Licensed After Serious Misconduct
item.description: Missouri’s system often takes years to resolve a misconduct allegation, in some cases allowing officers to move on to a new department.

item.title: A Mississippi Prison Murder Indictment Was Forgotten for 3 Years — Until a Reporter Called
item.description: John Lowe was beaten to death in a prison shower in 2021, but the murder suspect was not served the indictment because of bureaucratic missteps.
